results.title: Tuesday in November
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information and Arthur Zegart
results.brief_description: Portrays the 1944 American Presidential election from the pre-election nominating conventions through the party campaigns to election day in November. Explains the organisation and structure of government in the United States.

results.title: Tudawali
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Paul D. Barron and Barron Films
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Robert Tudawali who starred in the first ever Australian technicolour feature film, “Jedda”. Station hand, actor and then Aboriginal activist, Tudawali died in 1967 at the age of 38 in tragic circumstances. Includes brief excerpts from “Jedda” and from two early television series made in Australia, “Dust in the sun” and “Whiplash” Stars Ernie Dingo in the title role.

results.title: Trois Milliards Sans Ascenseur
results.creator_credit: Eugene Lepicier, Marcel Sebaoun, Andre Cohen and Roger Pigaut
results.brief_description:
Five friends living in a blue-collar neighborhood which is being demolished to make way for a new office and housing development band together to save their neighborhood and get rich along the way. They set up on a complicated plot involving both jewel theft and insurance fraud. Things get even more complicated when they call for the services of an expert burglar.

Credits: Producers, Andre Cohen, Marcel Sebaoun, Eugene Lepicier ; director, Roger Pigaut ; writers, Roger Pigaut, Andre G. Brunelin ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Teo Usuelli.
Cast: Serge Reggiani, Michel Bouquet, Francoise Rosay, Bernard Fresson, Dany Carrel, Amidou, Gabriele Ferzetti, Marcel Bozzuffi, Victor Lanoux, Nike Arrighi.

results.title: Trial on the Road
results.brief_description: Lazarev is a German soldier who is captured by a young and raw Russian partisan. Lazarev is himself Russian and had enlisted in the German forces when they had over-run his land. Lazarev’s initial test of loyalty comes when he is able to trick some German offices and overpower them. Finally his trial of loyalty is put to one supreme test when he is asked to lead a group attempting to hijack a train.

results.title: Trainspotting
results.creator_credit: Danny Boyle, Andrew McDonald, Channel 4, Noel Gay Motion Picture Company and Figment Films
results.brief_description: Based on the cult novel by Irvine Welsh, “Trainspotting” is a black comedy which looks at a group of junkies in Edinburgh. Mark Renton, “the hero” of the film takes the viewer on a journey of discovery. Heroin is his mistress and the need to find and use it dictates the course of everyday events in his life. Renton’s friends share the same passions and needs as they lie, steal, cheat, and go “off their faces” in order to procure the next fix. As they edge towards self-destruction, the film never loses sight of their vulnerability or their very human weaknesses. At times graphically squalid and bleak, the film is undeniably hilarious, although not for the weak-stomached. A great soundtrack is featured together with excellent performances by Ewan McGregor, Ewen Bremner, Jonny Lee Miller, Kevin McKidd, Kelly Macdonald and Robert Carlyle.

results.title: Trafficopter
results.brief_description: A view of Montreal as seen from the helicopter of one of the radio stations that reports on rush-hour traffic movement. Spread out below are the ant-runs of the city—freeways, interchanges, bridges, downtown arteries—and on them the thousands of vehicles, like so many dinky-toys, moving with the flow or jammed in massive tie-ups. It is a seething, teeming spectacle, a unique view of the city, artfully filmed, with comments by the traffic guide, Len Rowcliffe.

results.title: Toy story (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Arnold, Ralph Guggenheim, Walt Disney Pictures, Pixar Animation Studios and John Lasseter
results.brief_description: Awarded a special Academy Award for Special Achievement, this fully animated adventure is riotous fun for kids of all ages. When a draw-stringed cowboy named Woody, his boy’s favourite toy, is replaced one birthday by the latest toy - a flashy new space-ranger named Buzz Lightyear, it sparks an outrageous tiff between toys. Accidentally whisked away from home and into the clutches of the neighbourhood bully, these two squabbling rivals must work together as a team if they are to escape. Visual wizardry, uproarious laughs and the coolest characters ever assembled transform the world’s first computer-animated feature film into an incomparable movie marvel.

results.title: Tout va bien
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Gorin, Jean-Luc Godard, Empire Films, Vicco Films and Anouchka Films
results.brief_description: An American broadcaster and a former film director go to a factory to interview the manager about modern managerial methods and find it occupied by the workers who take them hostage. Supporters of the working class and student uprising that took place in France in 1968, they are forced to re-examine their commitment to the struggle and to each other. The film wittily examines the position of three major social forces in French society and the contradictions between them: the bourgeoisie, the working class and intellectuals. The basic concern is the part an intellectual can play in revolutionary movement of the working class. Cast includes Yves Montand and Jane Fonda.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Peter and Pompey
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Peter, Margaret and Wayne discover a Roman boat in a cave that contains the manuscript of young Pompey. The discovery changes the tiny little town of Gamma into a brash, hyped-up tourist centre. The children also find that their lives change too - and they don’t like what is happening. The manuscript found in the boat reveals that the boat is cursed and, until the boat is destroyed it will continue to curse anyone who comes into contact with it. The children decide that in order to save Gamma they must finally carry out the drastic act of destroying the boat.

results.title: Toot, whistle, plunk and boom
results.brief_description: Animated cartoons show the origin and development of musical instruments. Professor Owl tells his class how all music comes from a toot (the horns), whistle (woodwinds), plunk (strings) and boom (percussion). Explains how the complex instruments of the modern symphony orchestra and brass band developed from primitive forms and the effect of various refinements such as the valves on the brass horn.
